title: For Sale:  AR-15, 18" Spiral Fluted SS Barrel, Magpul MOE Furniture
postcontent:
Ladies, nothing says I Love You like an AR under the Christmas tree.....

The upper receiver is a forged Anderson made of forged, 7075 T6 aluminum. The barrel is an 18" spiral fluted, medium profile CFA made of 416 stainless steel with 1:8 twist.  It has a mid-length gas system, is chambered in .223 Wylde and is topped with a stainless steel, competition style muzzle brake. The handguard is a 12", free floating, ultra-slim profile Keymod rail with 3 moveable rail sections. The charge handle is an Anderson ambidextrous. The bolt carrier group is a Palmetto State Armory premium.  The bipod is a tactical UTG adjustable from 8.3" to 12.7" in height. 

The lower is a matching Anderson assembly with an ambidextrous, dual loop sling plate. The trigger group is nickel plated and polished making for a smooth, crisp feel.  The grip, the 6-position stock and the trigger guard are all Magpul MOE. A pair of new, Magpul PMag, 30-round magazines are included.

Optional: Add $75 and I will install a set of Magpul MBUS flip-up sights. The total would then be $855.

Cash only, no trades. The rifle is in new condition with no dings, scratches or handling marks. The buyer must be legal to own a firearm in Tennessee and must sign a bill of sale.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Remington Model 8 (Auto Loading Rifle) Chambered in .32 Remington (Discontinued)
postcontent:
I am looking to sell my recently acquired Remington Model 8. I have not fired a single bullet through the gun after purchase. The item has been inspected over and should shoot without issue. For its age the rifling looks great. If you are an avid hunter this would make a well tool. If you are a collector on the other hand this is not a recommended item, unless you are not looking for a pristine piece. This gun does have its cosmetics issues that are clear to see. The left side of the stock has two horizontal holes that may have been utilized for a cheek pad during use. There are also six Holes of equal spacing in a set of two rows (three holes per row) on the top portion of the (for lack of a better word) dust cover. These may have been used for a rail attachment, but I am uncertain of such. The serial number (20137) dates the rifle to being manufactured near the end of 1909. The rifle has also been stamped with EA3, this means the rifle was sent to Remington for repair October, 1932. The ammo for this rifle has been discontinued in 1964. The ammo is scarce to come by, but there are places online that re-manufacture the ammo for a reasonable price; it is even comparable to the price of the still manufactured .35 Remington. I am selling with the rifle one box of twenty (20) rounds of unfired pre-1964 .32 Remington ammo in original packaging. I am primarily looking for cash, but might consider a trade. I do have more images available upon request. Due to law constraints I will not accept handguns. This is not as to myself being in disorderly conduct or a manner there-of, but rather not meeting the age requirement to purchase such.
*If the advertisement is up, it is still available*
